qas.question: When did Musharraf give an anti-Islamism speech?
What did Musharraf say he'd combat?

answers.text: Islamic extremism and lawlessness within Pakistan

qas.question: What did Musharraf say his ban wasn't influenced by?
Who gave a speech for Islamic extremism?
When were the militant organizations banned?
What was extremism committed to rooting out?
Who was involved in the consultations?
What would be allowed to give itself a new name?

context: On <a0_0><b5_0>12 January 2002<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <b4_0>Musharraf<b4_0/> gave a speech against Islamic extremism. He unequivocally condemned all acts of terrorism and pledged to combat <a1_0>Islamic extremism and lawlessness within Pakistan<a1_0/> itself. He stated that <b6_0>his government<b6_0/> was committed to rooting out extremism and made it clear that the banned <a2_0><b8_0>militant organizations<b8_0/><a2_0/> would not be allowed to resurface under any new name. He said, "the recent decision to ban extremist groups promoting militancy was taken in the national interest after thorough consultations. It was not taken under any <a3_0><b7_0>foreign influence<b7_0/><a3_0/>".
